intro: Gymnosporia tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin gymnosporia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is characterized by its woody shrub structure and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam and southern China. Its fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release seeds when mature. Gymnosporia tonkinensis is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in shaded undergrowth.
